result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

NOTICE OF RIGHT TO SEEK POSTCONVICTION RELIEF
DEF PRESENT W/ATTY HAMM - CASE DISMISSED & READ IN
Letter received from Attorney Hamm to Judge Goodman dated June 2, 2015.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 06-10-2015 11:00 am
Letter received from Attorney Hamm to Judge Goodman dated June 1, 2015.
Letter received from Attorney Hamm to Judge Goodman dated May 4, 2015 (approved by Judge Goodman).
Letter received from Attorney Hamm to Judge Goodman dated April 3, 2015.
Schedule plea and sentencing.
Defendant appears in person with Attorney Hamm.  Court modifies bond conditions.

No consumption or possession of alcohol.  No entering taverns, bars or liquor stores for any purpose.
DEFENDANT MUST COMPLY WITH THE BOND MONITORING PROGRAM.  UPON POSTING OF THE BOND, DEFENDANT MUST APPEAR AT THE JUSTICE PROGRAM OFFICE TO SIGN UP DURING THE HOURS OF 8:00 A.M. - 4:30 P.M.  THE JUSTICE PROGRAM OFFICE IS LOCATED AT 919 HOESCHLER DRIVE, SUITE 100, SPARTA, WI.
Curfew 7pm-7am.
Defendant can be out past curfew as long as he gets approval from the Bond Monitoring Program 24 hours in advance.
Defendant must notifiy the Bond Monitoring Program of travel to and from work if employment takes him out of town.
Defendant may only be released Monday-Friday, 8am-4pm, so the defendant can sign up for Bond Monitoring Program.
Defendant must comply with the rules of the Bond Monitoring Program and be put on a Soberlink Device.
